newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesian rubber higher in noon trade.
newsitem.headline: Indonesian rubber higher in noon trade.

text.p: Indonesian tyre-grade SIR20 rubber prices were slightly higher in noon trading on Tuesday amid improved market sentiment, traders said.
They said U.S. buyers bought rubber at 47.75 U.S. cents/lb fob Jambi overnight, adding that offer prices in other centres improved because of rises in Tokyo and Singapore.
"We are glad because market sentiment is improving. In addition to the Tokyo and Singapore factors, tight supply in the local market has also boosted prices," said one trader.
Traders said offer prices were quoted at 48.50-49.00 cents fob Medan, 48.25 fob Palembang, 48.25-50 fob Padang and Surabaya and 47.75 fob Pontianak.
